plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub admired for its large, showy flowers that bloom in late fall to early spring. It thrives in temperate zones and is widely cultivated in gardens.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellias were a favorite flower of Queen Victoria and have been symbols of admiration and perfection in many cultures.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub tolerant of heat and drought, oleander blooms profusely in mild winter climates assuring vibrant flowers in December in suitable regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early winter, can bloom year-round in warm climates
plants.funFact: All parts of the oleander plant are highly toxic if ingested, but its beautiful flowers remain popular in landscaping.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant that blooms in midwinter, often around Christmas, producing white to pinkish flowers despite cold conditions.
plants.location: European mountain regions, cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose and has a folklore association with the nativity story.

plants.name: Rhododendron simsii
plants.description: A species of azalea that blooms in tropical to subtropical climates during winter months, adding color to gardens and wild areas.
plants.location: Southeast Asia, Southern China, and cultivated in similar climates
plants.funFact: Azaleas are known to be toxic to pets and humans but are widely prized for vibrant floral displays.
